privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.subtitle: Personal Data Processing Policy
privacy.intro: This Privacy Policy defines the rules for collecting, storing, using and protecting the personal data of users of the online store ‚ÄúWaterMelon‚Äù (wtmelon.store). We respect your privacy. When you place an order or contact support, you provide us with certain information, and we use it solely to fulfill your order, provide technical support, and handle requests.

section1.title: 1. GENERAL PROVISIONS
section1.p1: This Policy is developed in accordance with the applicable laws of Ukraine, including the Law of Ukraine ‚ÄúOn Personal Data Protection‚Äù.
section1.p2: By using the WaterMelon website, contacting us via official channels (messengers/social networks) and/or paying for an order, the User (Customer) consents to the processing of personal data under this Policy to the extent necessary to provide services and fulfill the order.
section1.p3: The personal data controller is Sole Proprietor (FOP) Sovha Yevheniia Vasylivna.

section2.title: 2. WHAT DATA WE COLLECT
section2.intro: We collect only the minimum information necessary to fulfill the order, communicate with you, and provide support:
section2.contact: Contact data: name (or nickname), messenger nickname/profile (e.g., Telegram), phone number, e-mail address.
section2.service: Data required to provide the service: data necessary to grant access (e.g., account e-mail, invitation link, profile identifier). In cases where, at your request, remote technical assistance is required, we may obtain temporary access data (login/password or another access method) exclusively for activation/setup and only with your explicit consent.
section2.payment: Payment data: we do not collect or store full bank card details (number, expiry date, CVV). Payment is made through a bank/payment gateway (acquiring, including Fondy or another provider), and we receive payment confirmation and basic payment attributes (amount, currency, status, transaction ID) to the extent necessary to fulfill the order and for accounting/tax purposes.
section2.technical: Technical data: IP address, browser and device type, event logs (mayFIDEMay be collected automatically for security, fraud prevention, and proper website operation).

section3.title: 3. PURPOSES OF DATA PROCESSING
section3.item1: Processing and fulfilling your order (providing access codes, invites, instructions, activation/setup).
section3.item2: Communicating with you via e-mail/messengers to confirm order details and provide technical support.
section3.item3: Resolving disputes and handling requests (access replacement, refunds, complaint review).
section3.item4: Informing you about the status of the order/subscription (service messages related to your order).

section4.title: 4. ACCOUNT DATA SECURITY (IMPORTANT)
section4.p1: If, for activation/setup, you voluntarily provide us with access data to your account:
section4.item1: We use this data solely to fulfill your order and provide technical assistance.
section4.item2: We do not use your access data for other purposes and do not disclose it to third parties without lawful grounds.
section4.item3: We do not change critical account parameters (e-mail/login/password/payment settings) unless it is required to fulfill the order and agreed with you.
section4.p2: After the service is completed (activation/setup), we recommend changing the password (or other access method) if you provided it during order fulfillment.

section5.title: 5. DISCLOSURE TO THIRD PARTIES
section5.intro: We do not sell or disclose your personal data to third parties, except where necessary to provide services or required by law, including:
section5.item1: Banks, payment systems, and payment providers/acquirers (e.g., Fondy or another provider) ‚Äî to process and confirm transactions, prevent fraud, and process refunds.
section5.item2: Communication services/messengers/e-mail services (Telegram, Viber, Instagram, e-mail providers) ‚Äî to the extent necessary to communicate with you and provide support.
section5.item3: Upon a justified request of public authorities ‚Äî in accordance with the laws of Ukraine.
section5.note: We do not share customer databases with spammers or advertising companies.

section6.title: 6. INFORMATION SECURITY AND RETENTION
section6.p1: Access to personal data is granted only to authorized persons who need it to fulfill orders and provide support. We apply organizational and technical security measures to prevent unauthorized access.
section6.p2: The website uses SSL/TLS encryption to protect data transmission.
section6.p3: Retention period: we store data no longer than necessary to fulfill the order, provide support, resolve disputes and/or comply with legal requirements (including payment accounting). When it is no longer needed, data may be deleted or anonymized.

section7.title: 7. USER RIGHTS
section7.intro: Under the laws of Ukraine, you have the right to:
section7.item1: Receive information about what data we process and for what purpose.
section7.item2: Request correction of inaccurate data or deletion of data if there are no lawful grounds for further storage.
section7.item3: Withdraw consent to data processing (this may make it impossible to fulfill the order or provide further support if such data is technically/legally necessary).
section7.note: To exercise these rights, please contact our support using the contacts below.

section8.title: 8. CONTACT INFORMATION

terms.intro: This document is a public offer (the ‚ÄúOffer‚Äù) of the online store ‚ÄúWaterMelon‚Äù (website wtmelon.store), represented by the Sole Proprietor (FOP) Sovha Yevheniia Vasylivna (the ‚ÄúProvider‚Äù), addressed to any legally capable individual and/or legal entity (the ‚ÄúCustomer‚Äù/‚ÄúConsumer‚Äù) to enter into an electronic agreement under the terms set out below. The Offer is made in accordance with the laws of Ukraine on e-commerce and consumer protection for distance contracts.

section1.title: 1. TERMS AND DEFINITIONS
section1.offer: Offer ‚Äî the Provider‚Äôs public proposal to enter into an agreement under the terms of this document, published on wtmelon.store and/or in WaterMelon‚Äôs official channels.
section1.acceptance: Acceptance ‚Äî full and unconditional acceptance of the Offer‚Äôs terms by performing one or more actions: placing an order, making payment, confirming consents (checkboxes), and/or actually receiving the Digital Good/Service.
section1.digitalGoods: Digital Good ‚Äî a digital product (codes/keys/e-vouchers/subscriptions/activations/access) supplied in electronic form and enabling the use of digital content or a service as described on the website.
section1.service: Digital Service / Service ‚Äî a service of arranging, setting up, supporting or providing technical assistance for obtaining and using the Digital Good/access.
section1.period: Access Period ‚Äî the period for which access/activation is provided under the selected plan.
section1.durableMedium: Durable medium ‚Äî a means that allows information to be stored for future use (including e-mail, a personal account on the website, or a file/message that can be saved).
section1.supportHours: Support working hours ‚Äî daily from 10:00 to 22:00 Kyiv time (unless otherwise stated on the website).

section2.title: 2. SUBJECT OF THE AGREEMENT

section2.p2: Specific terms (name, plan, duration, scope, delivery method, price) are determined by the information on the website and/or the manager‚Äôs confirmation and form an integral part of this agreement.
section2.p3: Certain Digital Goods/Services may be related to third-party services. The Customer undertakes to comply with the rules of such services.
section2.p31: Third-party brands status: Unless expressly stated otherwise, the Provider is not the owner, developer, or an official representative/distributor of third-party services. Trademarks, names and logos belong to their respective owners and are used solely to identify the relevant services. The terms of use of such services are determined by their Terms of Service, and the Customer undertakes to comply with them.
section2.p4: Official sales channels and agreements: The Provider operates based on agreements concluded with suppliers/partners and/or via marketplaces. In particular, for certain digital goods/subscriptions the Provider acts under supply agreements with suppliers (e.g., SWEET.TV branded digital goods with the right of further resale to end consumers). The Provider may also sell goods/services via marketplaces, including Rozetka (LLC ‚ÄúTerminal Rozetka‚Äù), in accordance with the rules and terms of such platforms.
section2.p5: Supporting documents: Upon a reasonable request from the acquiring bank/payment provider and/or competent authorities, the Provider may provide copies/extracts of documents confirming the legal basis for its activities, while maintaining confidentiality and/or redacting sensitive data (if necessary).
section2.p6: Related documents: The Privacy Policy, Refund Policy, Delivery & Payment Policy, as well as the ‚ÄúRequisites/Legal‚Äù page published on the website, are an integral part of WaterMelon‚Äôs service terms. In case of discrepancies, this Offer prevails.

section3.title: 3. LEGAL CAPACITY AND AGE
section3.p1: The Customer confirms that they have full legal capacity.
section3.p2: If the Customer is under 18 years old, they place the order and make payment with the consent of a legal representative.
section3.p3: The Customer also confirms compliance with any age restrictions of the relevant services/content providers.

section4.title: 4. ORDER PLACEMENT AND SUPPLY
section4.p1: Orders are placed on wtmelon.store or via a manager in WaterMelon‚Äôs official channels.
section4.p2: Supply is provided electronically and may include: (a) delivery of a code/key/voucher; (b) delivery of a link/invitation (invite) or instructions; (c) providing technical support/assistance.
section4.p3: Remote technical assistance: At the Customer‚Äôs separate request and with the Customer‚Äôs explicit consent, the Provider may provide remote technical assistance for setup/activation. In such case, the Provider uses the provided data/access solely to fulfill the order, does not change critical account parameters (email/login/password/payment settings) unless agreed with the Customer, and recommends changing the password after the work is completed (if applicable).
section4.p4: Estimated supply time: 15 minutes to 24 hours during support working hours, unless otherwise stated on the website/in the order confirmation.
section4.p5: Moment of fulfillment: The Digital Good/Service is deemed supplied/provided from the moment the code/link/instructions are delivered or access is actually enabled (whichever occurs first).
section4.p6: Start of the Access Period: If, for a particular Digital Good/subscription, the Access Period depends on actual activation on the service side, the Access Period starts from the moment of actual activation/access enablement, as confirmed by the service‚Äôs technical status and/or the Provider‚Äôs electronic message.
section4.p7: Order/payment confirmation (receipt/email/message) is provided to the Customer electronically (durable medium).

section5.title: 5. PRICE, CURRENCY AND PAYMENT
section5.p1: Prices are indicated on the website or communicated by the manager before payment.
section5.p2: Payment may be made in UAH / USD / EUR (depending on the payment page). Any conversion (if required) is performed by the Customer‚Äôs bank/payment system.
section5.p3: Payment methods: payment by bank card via acquiring/payment provider, transfer to the Provider‚Äôs IBAN, or other methods available on the website.
section5.p4: Payment is considered completed upon transaction confirmation by the payment system or upon crediting of funds to the Provider‚Äôs account.

If payment is not made within the agreed period, the Provider may suspend or cancel access until full settlement.
section5.p6: The Customer agrees that order/payment confirmations and messages regarding supply/replacement/refund may be sent by the Provider electronically (e-mail, messenger message, personal account), which constitutes a durable medium.

section6.title: 6. START OF PERFORMANCE BEFORE EXPIRY OF THE 14-DAY PERIOD AND THE RIGHT TO WITHDRAW

section6.p5: If the Customer has not provided the consent described in clause 6.3, the Provider starts fulfilling the order within the timeframe and by the method agreed with the Customer in messages and/or in the order confirmation.

section7.title: 7. WARRANTIES, CONFORMITY AND SUPPORT

section7.p2: If the Digital Good/Service is not provided, the Customer may request provision; if the Provider does not provide it within an additionally agreed or reasonable period, the Customer may withdraw from the agreement.
section7.p3: In case of non-conformity (access/activation does not work or works not as described), the Customer may request bringing it into conformity (restoration/replacement) or a proportionate price reduction/withdrawal ‚Äî in cases and in the manner provided by law.
section7.p4: Standard support response time ‚Äî up to 24 hours during support working hours.

section8.title: 8. REPLACEMENT AND REFUND PROCEDURE
section8.p1: If access/activation stops before the end of the Access Period not due to the Customer‚Äôs fault (including technical reasons on the service side), upon the Customer‚Äôs request the Provider within 24 hours: (a) restores access; or (b) provides a replacement (equivalent access/activation to the same service).
section8.p2: By mutual agreement, an alternative may be provided ‚Äî another digital good/service on equivalent terms.
section8.p3: If the Provider failed to provide/connect access due to its own fault or failed to restore/replace access within the timeframe in clause 8.1, the Customer may request: (a) a refund; or (b) a refund for the unused portion of the Access Period (pro rata).
section8.p4: Refunds are generally processed via the same payment method used for the transaction (bank card/payment provider/transfer). If a same-method refund is technically impossible or conflicts with the rules of the payment system/bank, the parties agree on another lawful refund method.
section8.p5: Contact channels: Requests regarding order fulfillment, access restoration/replacement and/or refunds are accepted via any contact channel indicated in the ‚ÄúRequisites/Contacts‚Äù section on the website.
section8.p6: Pro rata refund calculation: If a pro rata refund applies, the amount is calculated proportionally to unused days/period of the paid plan (e.g., payment amount / number of days in the Access Period √ó number of unused days), unless a different procedure is specified for a particular plan.
section8.p7: Refund timeframe: Refunds are processed within the period required by law and the payment system rules, but usually no later than 14 calendar days from the date the parties agree on the grounds for the refund (unless otherwise required by law or the bank/provider‚Äôs technical procedure).

section9.title: 9. USE RULES AND LIMITATION OF LIABILITY
